intro: Gustavia iquitosensis, commonly known as the Iquitos hibiscus, is a species of flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of red, pink, and white. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found near water sources in its natural habitat. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
